title: Workshop on Designing Math Games to Foster Social Problem-Solving Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Program for in-service secondary teachers to strengthen competencies in designing math-based social problem-solving games applicable to real classrooms. Participants experience iterative improvement and application through participatory design and heuristic evaluation methods

learning_goals: Analyze the educational playability of math games incorporating social issue-solving elements using heuristic evaluation criteria
Produce game prototypes (storyboards) reflecting learner needs through participatory design
Design specific challenge tasks and feedback mechanisms linked to learning objectives when developing games
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
